intro: Tetrardisia disticha, commonly known as the two-branched tetrardisia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers with four stamens. Its fruit is a capsule that disperses seeds through wind. It is often found in moist, shaded environments within lowland forests.
